{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3489189,"name":"Mohammed Almojtaba","username":"Malmojtaba","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/malmojtaba/{size}/238226_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T20:40:16.791Z","cooked":"

Hey everyone,

I wanted to start a new thread dedicated to helping students and teams navigate the 3DExperience Platform, especially for those considering it as a replacement for GrabCAD. I’ve been exploring the platform and thought I’d share some insights and comparisons to help others get started.

Why Consider 3DExperience Platform?

The 3DExperience Platform offers a comprehensive suite of tools that can potentially replace GrabCAD and provide additional benefits. Here are a few reasons why it might be a great option:

  1. Integrated Collaboration: Unlike GrabCAD, which primarily focuses on file sharing, 3DExperience offers integrated project management and collaboration tools through 3DSpace. This allows teams to manage their projects, track progress, and collaborate more effectively.
  2. Cloud Storage and Access: With 3DDrive, you get cloud storage similar to GrabCAD, but with the added advantage of seamless integration with other 3DExperience apps. This means you can access your files from anywhere and collaborate in real-time.
  3. Advanced Design Tools: The platform includes powerful design tools like SOLIDWORKS, which are integrated into the 3DExperience ecosystem. This can streamline your workflow and enhance your design capabilities.
    check this:

3DEXPERIENCE SOLIDWORKS Add-In

Comparison: 3DSpace vs. 3DDrive

  • 3DSpace: This is your project hub where you can create and manage collaborative spaces. It’s designed for team collaboration, project management, and storing all your design data in one place.
  • 3DDrive: Think of this as your cloud storage solution. It allows you to store, share, and access your files from anywhere, similar to GrabCAD, but with better integration with other 3DExperience tools.

Getting Started Tips

  1. Upgrade to the Latest Version: Make sure you’re using the latest version of SOLIDWORKS (2023-2024) to avoid compatibility issues. Uninstall any older versions, install the new one, and reboot your system.
  2. Browser Settings: If you’re having trouble with 3DExperience in your browser, try clearing your cache and cookies or use Incognito mode. Switching to a different browser like Edge might also help.
  3. Activate the Add-In: Ensure that the 3DEXPERIENCE Add-In is properly installed and activated in SOLIDWORKS. This is crucial for seamless integration.
  4. Create Collaborative Spaces: Set up your Collaborative Space from the browser window using the 3DSpace App. This will help you manage your projects and collaborate with your team effectively.

SOLIDWORKS FRIST Sponsorship:
Free SOLIDWORKS for FIRST® Teams | SOLIDWORKS

I hope this helps anyone who’s feeling a bit lost with the 3DExperience Platform. Feel free to share your experiences, tips, and any issues you’re facing. Let’s help each other make the most of this powerful tool!

Good Luck!

3D ContentCentral ® is a website that provides access to 3D CAD models from component suppliers and individual users in all major CAD formats like SOLIDWORKS.

How to Get Started Using 3D ContentCentral

In the SOLIDWORKS Task Pane , click Design Library . In the Design Library, expand 3D ContentCentral .

There are two subcategories: Supplier Content and User Library .

Screenshot (129).PNG1338×1026 64.3 KB

  • Supplier Content : Suppliers publish their CAD model catalogs directly to 3D Content Central, making the models available for users to download for free. You can browse All Categories and All Suppliers.
  • User Library : Individual users upload their CAD models to share with other users.

How to Create a 3D ContentCentral Account

Expand Supplier Content or User Library and click on one of the subfolders, then choose Click here for all categories , suppliers , or home page . This will take you to the appropriate 3D ContentCentral website page. You can browse or search for models within the website, but to download you must create an account. Click Log In in the upper right corner.

Screenshot (130)2580×148 150 KB

If you do not already have an account, click Sign Up on the next screen and provide an email address and password to create the account.

Screenshot (131)1324×1208 254 KB

Note: 3D ContentCentral can also be accessed outside of SOLIDWORKS at https://www.3dcontentcentral.com/

How to download CAD models

Once you have created an account, downloads will become available. You may browse the list of Suppliers, Supplier Categories, or User Categories or, you can use the search at the top of the site to find models.

In this example, I have completed a search for a 4-way push button and found one from the supplier Eaton Electric. Clicking on the picture of the file will redirect me to a page where I can view and download.

Screenshot (132)2632×608 202 KB

On the next page, there is an embedded eDrawings viewer of the model. Using the left mouse button you can click and drag on the picture of the model to rotate, and use the scroll button to zoom in and out.

Under Download the file, there is a drop-down list of possible 3D CAD file formats. I’ll choose SOLIDWORKS from the list and click the download button. This will download the file directly to my Downloads folder and I can begin using the file in my assembly.

Screenshot (133).PNG1920×887 42 KB

How to Share CAD Models With 3D ContentCentral

If you wish to share a model that you have created, right-click on 3D ContentCentral in the SOLIDWORKS Task Pane , and click Share a Model .

Screenshot (134).PNG1356×1024 66.2 KB

The 3D ContentCentral log in screen will fill your SOLIDWORKS graphics area. Use your email and password to log in, then accept the agreement. Next, you can drag and drop the model from Windows Explorer or choose Select from Computer to browse for the file.

Screenshot (135).PNG1920×821 80.1 KB

SOLIDWORKS Corporation will review your model and inform you (via email) if the model is acceptable for sharing.
SOLIDWORKS Corporation will review your model and inform you (via email) if the model is acceptable for sharing.

Why 3DContentCentral Might Be Your Best Bet:

  1. Extensive Library of Customizable 3D Models: 3DContentCentral offers a vast selection of pre-made designs that you can customize to fit your specific needs. Whether it’s unique parts or components, you’ll find what you need quickly and easily.
  2. Streamlined Efficiency & Speed: Gain immediate access to ready-to-use models, saving you precious time during the build season. Focus on perfecting your strategy and innovation rather than spending hours on design.
  3. Seamless Software Integration: Works smoothly with various CAD software packages, allowing you to import parts directly into your designs without any hassle. This seamless integration ensures a smoother workflow.
  4. Supportive & Growing Community: While 3DContentCentral’s community is growing, it’s filled with passionate engineers and designers who are eager to help and share ideas, ensuring you get the support you need.
  5. Flexibility in Design: Customization is key in FRC. 3DContentCentral allows you to adapt and personalize parts to meet the unique challenges of the REEFSCAPE game, giving you an edge over the competition.

If you need supplier-specific, reliable models for professional projects, or if you’re heavily using SOLIDWORKS, 3D ContentCentral is the better choice.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-22T21:11:47.576Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":186,"readers_count":185,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482923,"topic_slug":"is-3dexperience-platform-a-great-replacement-for-grabcad","display_username":"Mohammed Almojtaba","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":"SOLIDWORKS_Staff","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/4X/1/5/3/15380fa4def8aaf1116111e30c712ddadb5e12ec.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":69,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28413,"username":"Andrew_L","name":"Andrew Lawrence","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_l/{size}/270442_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69482,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC focus Engineer @ SOLIDWORKS"},"post_url":"/t/is-3dexperience-platform-a-great-replacement-for-grabcad/482923/4","custom_user_title":"FRC focus Engineer @ SOLIDWORKS","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3490125,"name":"Andrew Lawrence","username":"Andrew_L","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_l/{size}/270442_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-22T21:01:06.025Z","cooked":"
Malmojtaba:

3D ContentCentral is the better choice.

You’re not wrong, a service that exists is in fact better than a service that no longer exists.

GrabCAD Workbench was used by teams to easily share team CAD files. Teams weren’t using it for “supplier-specific, reliable models for professional projects”, they used it to share and maintain their CAD files within private groups for members of their team. It was simple, light, and had a great UI.

Respectfully, teams don’t want a public repository of supplier parts, they want a replacement for GrabCAD workbench. Just recreate that, and teams who still use Solidworks will gladly use it. The loss of GrabCAD has been the greatest win for Onshape in the educational and hobbyist community because other CAD systems do not seem to understand what the educational and hobbyist userbase is looking for. This group does not want complex and heavy industrial products, they just want GrabCAD workbench.

Andrew_L:

they want a replacement for GrabCAD workbench. Just recreate that

It’s even easier than that, SolidWorks PDM does everything GrabCAD workbench did, and does it better. They just need to figure out how to make easier to setup. (Right now it’s targeted at larger enterprise users and requires you to manage your own servers)

Or even bring back PDM workgroup! Setting up a full fledged PDM standard/professional instance is asking for A LOT from teams.

This sounds more like MKCAD but for Solidworks. Do any FRC suppliers upload models to 3D ContentCentral?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-22T21:11:47.595Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":40.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482923,"topic_slug":"is-3dexperience-platform-a-great-replacement-for-grabcad","display_username":"ehochstein","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69482,"username":"Malmojtaba","name":"Mohammed Almojtaba","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/malmojtaba/{size}/238226_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11940,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 461←2470"},"post_url":"/t/is-3dexperience-platform-a-great-replacement-for-grabcad/482923/8","custom_user_title":"FRC 461←2470","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3490180,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-22T21:39:59.932Z","cooked":"
Malmojtaba:

Unlike GrabCAD, which primarily focuses on file sharing, 3DExperience offers integrated project management and collaboration tools through 3DSpace.

Quite frankly I find this very unhelpful. I’ve been using mechanical CAD for over a decade, working with a large number of different companies and a couple different CAD programs. There are three things I use as an integral part of the CAD process: modeling (CAD), file sharing, and CAM. I don’t even know what “integrated project management and collaboration tools” means if not file sharing. Right now my team is using Fusion for CAM and SolidWorks for CAD and are happy enough with those products, but since the loss of GrabCAD workbench we have been trying various replacements with nothing really working well. Filesharing is basically the only thing I want.

If 3Dexperience can be used as a simple file sharing platform, please give us a guide to setting it up and using it for that purpose. I’ve honestly been unable to understand if 3DExperience could be used to manage files while still using desktop SolidWorks, and if so how to set it up.

We almost set up solidworks PDM last year when grabCAD went down, but we decided that once the one passionate person behind the project graduated, upkeep would be confusing for most people and deemed it not worth it. I do wish it was easier, it would be better than CacheCAD

Yes, 3DEXPERIENCE can be used as a file-sharing platform while keeping your desktop SOLIDWORKS workflow intact. It might seem overwhelming at first because the platform offers a ton of functionality beyond file sharing, but for your specific need. you can use (( SOLIDWORKS Cloud Apps for FIRST teams)), here’s how it works:

  1. Install and Connect:
  • You’ll need to install the 3DEXPERIENCE Connector for SOLIDWORKS. This bridges your desktop SOLIDWORKS with the platform.
  • Once installed, you can access 3DEXPERIENCE directly from the SOLIDWORKS Task Pane.
  1. Organize Files:
  • Files can be stored in “Collaborative Spaces” on the platform. Think of these as cloud-based folders for your team to share and organize CAD data.
  • You can upload parts, assemblies, and drawings directly from SOLIDWORKS into the platform.
  1. Version Control and Sharing:
  • Files stored in 3DEXPERIENCE automatically track versions. Your team will always know who has the latest version and can work collaboratively without overwriting each other’s work.
  • You can share files securely with external users by providing them access to specific spaces or using export/download options.
  1. Offline Mode:
  • If you’re working offline, you can check out files to your local machine, work on them, and sync changes back to the platform when you’re connected.

check this video too:

If my team is storing our files in 3DExperience and using desktop solidworks, will I be able to open files with out internet as long as I had previously downloaded them through the SW add-in even if I never checked them out? For example I’m at a competition with no internet and I need to 3d print a replacement part, so I would need to open the part and export a .3mf or possibly save a copy locally to make a new revision that could be uploaded to 3DExperience later.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:37:29.039Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":36.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482923,"topic_slug":"is-3dexperience-platform-a-great-replacement-for-grabcad","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":69482,"username":"Malmojtaba","name":"Mohammed Almojtaba","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/malmojtaba/{size}/238226_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-3dexperience-platform-a-great-replacement-for-grabcad/482923/19","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3490954,"name":"Mohammed Almojtaba","username":"Malmojtaba","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/malmojtaba/{size}/238226_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T20:29:30.850Z","cooked":"

Yes, if your team is storing files in 3DEXPERIENCE and using desktop SOLIDWORKS (( 3DExperience SOLIDWORKS - SOLIDWORKS Connected)), you can open previously downloaded files without an internet connection, even if you didn’t formally “check them out,” provided they were cached locally via the SOLIDWORKS 3DEXPERIENCE add-in. Here’s how it works and what to keep in mind:

How It Works:

  1. Local Cache Mechanism:
  • When you open a file from 3DEXPERIENCE using the SOLIDWORKS add-in, a copy of that file is cached locally on your computer. This allows you to open it later without needing internet access.
  1. Exporting and Editing Offline:
  • As long as the file is cached, you can:
    • Open the file in SOLIDWORKS offline.
    • Export it as a .3mf or other formats for 3D printing.
    • Save a local copy, make revisions, and upload the updated version to 3DEXPERIENCE when back online.
  1. Offline Workflow for Modifications:
  • If you need to revise a part offline, SOLIDWORKS will let you make changes to the cached file. Once you reconnect to the internet, you can manually upload the updated version to the platform and resolve any versioning conflicts.

Steps to Ensure Offline Access:

  1. Before Going Offline:
  • Open all the files you think you might need in SOLIDWORKS while connected to the internet. This ensures they are cached locally.
  • Optionally, use the Reserve (Check Out) function to explicitly lock and download the files for offline use.
  1. At the Competition:
  • Open cached files in SOLIDWORKS.
  • Export them for 3D printing or save local revisions as needed.
  1. After Reconnecting:
  • Re-sync your files to 3DEXPERIENCE by uploading the revised versions.

Important Notes:

  • Files you haven’t opened or downloaded while online won’t be accessible offline.
